item.title: 10/16/23 NFT Standards
item.dc:creator: radiantblocstg
item.content:encoded:
We are a step closer to Atomicals and NFT-minting in wallets!

Thanks to the diligent efforts by Radiant's volunteer developers, Radiant proudly announces the establishment of our first NFT standards which will facilitate construction and trading of NFTs.

Copied from the community Discord channel:

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Radiant Community Website
item.dc:creator: radiantblocstg
item.content:encoded:
Radiant

A next-gen Layer I hybrid account/UTXO blockchain for digital assets and interchain commerce

Roadmap
Whitepaper

INDUCTION PROOFS

UTXO

ACCOUNT EMULATION

COMMUNITY-OWNED

PROOF-OF-WORK

TURING COMPLETE LAYER 1

INSTANT TRANSACTIONS

ATOMICALS READY

FEATURES IN DEVELOPMENT

LIVE GAMING & AUCTIONS

Radiant (RXD) uses 0-conf to enable instant transfers for live gaming and auctions - all while relying on the stability and performance of 5-minute block times and nearly unlimited block size to carry enough data to enable live gaming at 500k tps.

CROSSBRIDGING

Pay-to-ref, and induction system for complete p2p fidelity of cross-chain transfers of tokens after BTC and RXD integration of the Atomicals UTXO NFT standard. All without the need for electrumx. Transfer your assets and other stores of value on and off Radiant with no fear of mutability.

NFTs/FTs

Radiant's Induction Proof system enables management of NFTs without an EVM. Radiant's newly released NFT standards will enable the minting of NFTs from Radiant's own Photonic Wallet. Atomical standards will allow NFTs to transfer across chains with 100% fidelity.

Learn more: Photonic, NFTs/FTs

SMART CONTRACTS

Radiant's hybrid UTXO and account-based infrastructure offers steep advantages in performance, and flexibility of smart contracts - without the reliance on an EVM.

Link: Programming SCs, Example SCs

FEATURES IN DEVELOPMENT

RADIANT-AS-A-SERVICE

Radiant can act as an interchain marketplace through Radiant DEX swap pairs. Altcoins without smart contract capabilities can swap into Radiant, execute smart contracts, and then swap out again to their altcoin. Radiant's integration of Atomicals, Induction, and pay-to-ref ensures fidelity of all cross-chain transactions.

RADIANT DEX

A decentralized exchange with RXD pairs that leverages the fidelity of interchain transfers on/off Radiant. Trade RXD Layer 2 tokens, or coins/NFTs from a completely different chain. This uniquely positions our DEX to become a hub of inter-chain commerce.

Link: Read more

RADIANTSCRIPT

A Script-based compiling language for designing smart contracts on Radiant.

Link: Learn more

NEWS AND DEVELOPMENTS

PARADIGM-SHIFTING

Radiant's unique design resolves limitations of UTXO-based chains

Radiant's technology and account emulation allows our UTXO-based blockchain to act as a digital ledger, which is normally a roadblock for traditional UTXO chains. Radiant solves the back-to-genesis problem with Induction Proofs and without the need for centralized indexers found on other blockchains.

Learn more: RXD & UTXO, Acct. Emulation,

Radiant balances security, scalability, and decentralization

Community-operated and not owned by any centralized entity. Proof-of-Work, split-node system, and instant transactions on scalable 5-min blocks with large max capacity (>10 GBs).

Learn more: RXD & Trilemma,

Radiant leverages BTC developments better than BTC does itself.

Development on Radiant is streamlined by using a shared Script-derived coding language also used by BTC. Radiant's combination of 0-conf, pay-to-ref and hybrid UTXO/account structure offers greater inter-chain fidelity, speed, and scalability than BTC does.

Radiant's unique combination of tech has boundless potential

Radiant's Layer 1 split-node syatem, 0-conf, hybrid structure, Induction Proofs, and Turing Completeness all position Radiant to become a supremely flexible general ledger and live event blockchain network. Radiant is well-positioned to be an enduring blockchain for our future; the future is Radiant.

Listen to more about our tech: Our Founder: Atoshi's Interview

BLOCKCHAIN INFO

RXD INFO

EMISSIONS & SUPPLY SCHEDULE

DECENTRALIZED

All of Radiant's developments, Discord & Telegram channels, and websites (including this one) are actively maintained by community volunteers - just like Bitcoin; We are not owned or controlled by any centralized enterprise or entity.

The coin is crowdfunded and was fairly launched. There was no ICO, no premine, and no founder's fee. Check our genesis block to verify!

All Radiant community members are on the team!

External Media Links

Our Founder: Atoshi's Interview

Technical Links

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: radiantblocstg
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: https://radiantblocstg.wpenginepowered.com.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.dc:creator: radiantblocstg
item.content:encoded:
Radiant

A next-generation Layer I blockchain for digital assets

[Roadmap]
[Whitepaper]

UTXO

COMMUNITY-OWNED

PROOF-OF-WORK

TURING COMPLETE L1

INSTANT TRANSACTIONS

Radiant (RXD) is a community-operated and scalable Layer 1 project with instant transactions for smart contracts and live streaming.

Radiant follows the tradition of Bitcoin by being decentralized, and free from manipulation by VCs, businesses, banks, or any other team and business entity.

Radiant is actively developing through a growing and participative community.

FEAURES UNDER DEVELOPMENT:

LIVE GAMING & AUCTIONS

Radiant uses 0-conf infrastructure to enable instant transfers for live gaming, auctions.

CROSSBRIDGING

Atomicals, pay-to-ref, and induction system for complete p2p fidelity of cross-chain transfers [PLACEHOLDER: idk what I'm talking about here... I need help with this text]

NFTS

The new editor comes with a handful of default blocks such as paragraph, image, gallery, and more, to help you create better standard posts and pages.

SMART CONTRACTS

Radiant was released as a scalable Layer 1 project that has the throughput to handle smart contracts with ETH-like flexibility, but with negligible fees. [Are their specific technologies I should mention here that make Radiant superior from others?]

[IMAGE: BLOCKCHAIN CHARACTERISTICS]

RADIANT'S TECHNOLOGY

Radiant harnesses 0-conf [who proposed this tech? Wasn't it in a whitepaper before Radiant? Giving it some credibility with a name would help] to allow instant transactions and facilitates live gaming and auctions. At the same time, Radiant uses 5-minute block times and massive max block size capability (> 10 GBs) to ensure that all transactions are recorded quickly. Since release, Radiant's Layer 1 is designed to be capable of smart contracts, whereas other altcoins, like ETH have/will require massive time and spending in building a Layer 2 with this capability. This allows instant and live transactions, maximizes data throughput for gaming and digital assets, minimizes transaction fees, while also ensuring that miners are rewarded with transaction-dense blocks.

Radiant's code (Script or RadiantScript) is ported from BTC and BSV, which were built extensively by many developers. This allows us to benefit and adapt future developments on those chains by making most BTC developments port easily into Radiant's superior scaffolding.

[IMAGE: BLOCKCHAIN CHARACTERISTICS]

DECENTRALIZED: COMMUNITY-LED

All of Radiant's developments, Discord & Telegram channels, and websites (including this one) are actively maintained by community volunteers - just like Bitcoin; We are not owned or controlled by any centralized entity or team.

All volunteers working on Radiant have the option of remaining anonymous.

The coin is crowdfunded and was fairly launched. There was no ICO, no premine, and no founder's fee. No need to take our word for that; please check our genesis block to verify!

Our growth accelerates with the volunteer efforts of our expanding community. We appreciate all efforts - big and small!

LINKS

item.title: 9/13/23 Radiant Community Report
item.dc:creator: radiantblocstg
item.content:encoded:
Today we celebrate the release of the newest edition of the Radiant Community Report. It contains 120+ pages of news, plans, and detailed descriptions of Radiant's present and future capabilities.

Most coins hype up incremental but meaningless news to give the impression of progress - here we group it together with detailed context.

We invite DYORs and developers to check it out:

Radiant Community Report

item.title: df
item.dc:creator: radiantblocstg
item.content:encoded:
Radiant

A Layer I hybrid blockchain for digital assets

Roadmap
Whitepaper

INDUCTION PROOF

UTXO

COMMUNITY-OWNED

PROOF-OF-WORK

TURING COMPLETE LAYER 1

INSTANT TRANSACTIONS

ATOMICALS READY

Radiant (RXD) is a scalable Layer 1 hybrid blockchain with the advantages of both UTXO and account-based architecture.

Radiant follows the tradition of Bitcoin and is free from manipulation by VCs, businesses, banks, teams, or any other entity.

Radiant is new and actively developing through a growing and participative community.

FEATURES IN DEVELOPMENT:

LIVE GAMING & AUCTIONS

Radiant (RXD) uses 0-conf infrastructure to enable instant transfers for live gaming and auctions - all while relying on the stability and performance of 5-minute block times and nearly unlimited block size to carry enough data to enable live gaming at 500k tps.

CROSSBRIDGING

Pay-to-ref, and induction system for complete p2p fidelity of cross-chain transfers of tokens after BTC and RXD integration of the Atomicals UTXO NFT standard. All without the need for electrumx. With these advantages together, RXD will leverage Atomicals better than BTC itself.

NFTS

Radiant's Induction Proof system enables management of NFTs without an EVM. Radiant's newly-released NFT standards will enable the minting of NFTs from Radiant's own Photonics Wallet.

SMART CONTRACTS

Radiant's hybrid UTXO and account-based infrastructure offers steep advantages in performance, and flexibility of smart contracts - without the reliance on an EVM.

Liin

NEWS:

RADIANT'S TECHNOLOGY

Radiant's code is a fork of BCH, but also includes new OP codes for Turing Completeness and induction proofs to solve the back-to-genesis problem. Radiant has the world's first hybrid design of UTXO and Account-based. It's UTXO design improves its performance while still offering the contracting ability of account-based blockchains based off of the Ethereum Virtual Machine.

Radiant utilizes 0-conf transactions, which has been used extensively and safely by BCHSV, to facilitate instant transactions and enable live gaming and auctions. At the same time, Radiant uses 5-minute block times and massive max block size capability (> 10 GBs) to ensure that all transactions are recorded quickly. Since release, Radiant's Layer 1 is designed to be capable of ETH-like smart contracts, whereas other altcoins need to build a Layer 2 with this capability. This allows instant and live transactions, maximizes data throughput for gaming and digital assets, minimizes transaction fees, while also ensuring that miners are rewarded with transaction-dense blocks.

Radiant's code (Script or RadiantScript) is ported from BTC and BSV, which were built extensively by many developers. This allows us to benefit and adapt future developments on those chains by making most BTC developments port easily into Radiant's superior scaffolding.

Radiant is in its early-stages of development and new capabilities are always being added.

Sources: Radiant Whitepaper and Radiant Community Report

BLOCKCHAIN INFO

RXD INFO

EMISSIONS & SUPPLY SCHEDULE

DECENTRALIZED: COMMUNITY-LED

All of Radiant's developments, Discord & Telegram channels, and websites (including this one) are actively maintained by community volunteers - just like Bitcoin; We are not owned or controlled by any centralized entity or team. The principal founder of the project (psuedonamed "Atoshi") executed a planned retirement from the project in the tradition of Satoshi himself, which enables the community to run the blockchain democratically without the distraction or influence of any perceived leaders. Several teams of volunteer and hobby developers now are building on Radiant.

All volunteers working and building on this platform have a right to privacy - or even to remain incommunicado.

The coin is crowdfunded and was fairly launched. There was no ICO, no premine, and no founder's fee. No need to take our word for that; you can check our genesis block to verify!

All Radiant community members are on the team!
